verses.verse: {False and True Worship} d "Shout aloud! Don't hold back! Lift up your voice like a trumpet! Declare to my people their rebellions, {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT read rebellion} and to the house of Jacob their sins.

They {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b 4QIsa d LXX; MT reads And they} seek me day after day, {Lit. me day and day ; so 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b 4QIsa d MT read me day, day} and are eager to know my ways, as if they were a nation that practices righteousness and has not forsaken the justice of their God. "They ask me to reveal just decisions; they are eager to draw near to God.

«Why have we fasted,'they ask, {1QIsa a 1QIsa b 4QIsa d LXX MT lack they ask} «but you do not see? «Why have we humbled ourselves,'{So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b LXX; MT reads ourself} they ask, {1QIsa a 1QIsa b 4QIsa d LXX MT lack they ask} «but you take no notice?»" {Fasting that God Approves} d"Look! On your fast day you serve your own interest and oppress all your workers.
"Look! You fast only for quarreling, and for {So 1QIsa b 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack for} fighting, and for hitting with wicked fists. You cannot fast as you do today and have your voice heard on high.

"Is this the kind of fast that I have chosen, merely a day for a person to humble himself? Is it merely for bowing down one's head like a bulrush, for lying {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b ; MT LXX read and for lying} on sackcloth and ashes? Is this what you {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa d LXX (plural); 1QIsa b MT (sing.)} call a fast, an {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b ; MT reads and an} acceptable day to the Lord ?

Isn't this the {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX lack the} fast that {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX lack that} I have been choosing: to loose the bonds of injustice, and {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX lack and} to untie the cords of the yoke, and {So 1QIsa a MT; 1QIsa b 4QIsa d LXX lack and} to let the oppressed go free, and to break every yoke?

Isn't it to share your bread with the hungry, and to bring the homeless poor into your house; when you see the naked, to cover him with clothing, {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX lack with clothing} and not to raise yourself up {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT read to hide yourself ; LXX reads to disregard} from your own flesh and blood?"

{God's Reward} d "Then your light will break forth like the dawn, and your healing will spring up quickly; and your vindication will go before you, and {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b LXX; MT lacks and} the glory of the lord will guard your back.

Then you'll call, and the Lord will answer; you'll cry for help, and he'll respond, «Here I am. '"If you do away with the yoke among you, and {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT lack and} pointing fingers and malicious talk;
if you pour yourself out for the hungry and satisfy the needs of afflicted souls, then your light will rise in darkness, and your night will be like noonday.

And the Lord will guide you continuously, and satisfy your soul in parched places, {1QIsa a spells the word places incorrectly} and they {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b ; MT reads he ; LXX reads and your bones will be strengthened} will strengthen your bones; and you'll be like a watered garden, like a spring of water, whose waters never fail.

And your people will rebuild the ancient ruins; You'll raise up the age-old foundations, {Lit. the foundations of many generations} and people will call you {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX read you will be called} «Repairer of Broken Walls,'«Restorer of Streets to Live In.'

"If you keep your feet from trampling the Sabbath, from {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa n ; 1QIsa b MT lack from} pursuing your own interests on my holy day, if you call the Sabbath a delight and {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b 4QIsa n ; MT LXX lack and} the Lord's holy day honorable; and if you honor it by not going your own ways {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa n MT; 1QIsa b reads way} and {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT lack and} seeking your own pleasure or speaking merely idle {1QIsa a 1QIsa b 4QIsa n MT LXX lack merely idle} words,

then you will take delight in the Lord , and he {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b 4QIsa n LXX; MT reads and I} will make you ride upon the heights of the earth; and he {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b 4QIsa n MT read and I} will make you feast on the inheritance of your ancestor Jacob, your father. "Yes! The mouth of the Lord has spoken."
